N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 432.3 - Instructions to distributors and retailers

State Regulations
(a) Every manufacturer or private labeler
shall annually at the commencement of the heating season provide written
instructions to its distributors and, either directly or through the
distributors, to ultimate retailers of its portable kerosene heaters in New

York State, instructing that there be prominently and conspicuously displayed
at the point of sale a sign advising prospective purchasers; (1)
that sale or use of portable kerosene
heaters may be locally restricted and of the need to check applicable local
laws and ordinances; and
(2)
that

State law prohibits the use of any portable kerosene heater in multiple
dwellings of three or more families. (b) Ultimate retailers of portable kerosene
heaters shall prominently and conspicuously and in accordance with instructions
received pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section display a sign advising
prospective purchasers: (1)
that sale or use
of portable kerosene heaters may be locally restricted, and of the need to
check applicable local laws and ordinances; and
(2)
that State law prohibits the use of any
portable kerosene heater in multiple dwellings of three or more
families. Notes
